Message.Title: TSLA is THE strongest momentum stock
Message.Msg: Momentum Train provides THE best tip: Tesla Motors (TSLA) is THE strongest momentum stock on the market currently. It was up 200% in the past year, but it is only at the very early beginning of its rally because it reported an outstanding quarterly report and Consumer Report rated TSLA Model S car with a score of 99, the highest score ever given to any car in the history. Tesla is the builder of THE BEST car of the world! This very young company has explosive revenue growth rate of 1,700%. Tesla is becoming THE best automaker in the world. Get on board the momentum train and load up this explosive growth stock TSLA while the company is still very young and the stock is still dirt cheap.
Hay!! The guy warned us about this drop. It isn't his fault we didn't pay attention.

Topic.Title: Is it time for Republicans to forgive democrats for being racists

Message.Msg: Actually the word Niger is sort of a compliment. The best, strongest, and smartest slaves were from Nigeria and when slave auctions were held the auctioneer would claim the slave being auctioned was a "Niger" in order to raise the price.

Topic.Title: Is it time for Republicans to forgive democrats for being racists

Message.Msg: Your reading comprehension skills are lacking, Geoffrey. Wilkes was commenting on cultural norms 200 years ago, not today. His comment is based on historical fact. Grow some thicker skin, dork.

Topic.Title: Is it time for Republicans to forgive democrats for being racists

Message.Msg: I am kind of proud that my slave great, great. grandfather married the masters daughter and was given a small farm as a wedding present. He was from England and, if he were being auctioned, no one would believe the auctioneer if he tried to pass him off as being from Nigeria.

Topic.Title: Is it time for Republicans to forgive democrats for being racists

Message.Msg: I've been in many fights with these wonderful people. Usually 2 or three on my back. I never use the "N" word as I know they don't l;ike it. You would probably be attacked in S. Central LA because you are White. Phone company employees years ago had a wildcat strike over what was happening there.. The gang would send a kid over to the M'H to pee on the guy down there. When he came up they would assault him. The company finally acquesced and put two men on the job in certain areas. One to watch on top while the other worked. Nothing like that happened in White areas.

Message.Title: Has Anyone Noticed T's Numbers ?
Message.Msg: Has anyone noticed how today's numbers on Yahoo are skewed ? I first noticed this on another Yahoo Stock Page when it said this "X" stock was 'up $1.05" and the math didn't compute correctly on the "opening" or the prev. "closing" The "daily" gains or losses are SOMETIMES taken from the "opening price" .. and SOMETIMES from the prev. day closing - during the same trade day ! I noticed T's gain at "opening price" was used about 2:30 p.m. or so (??) .. but the "prev. day closing" numbers were being used just prior to "T"'s closing .... Anyone else notice this today .. was T really up 58 cents earlier today ??
Harvard? You insult the crimson and flatter this child-p0ster.

Topic.Title: This is one ugly stock right now..

Message.Msg: Same. Just trying to help out those not as intelligent as I. Osso
Yep. That penny dashed my plans. Ah well, I guess the 50' Hinkley will just have to wait a while longer. How did the rest of your stocks do today? up, Up, UP I would imagine.

I fished out my strong box and found 1 receipt from 3/18/86 on my 10oz Johnson Matthey bars. Each 10oz. bar was $69.30 - plus local sales tax. The good thing about the 10oz. bars and higher, is they're serial numbered for your own proof of ownership, not transfer, in case of theft or robbery. My 5oz. bars and 1 oz. bars & rounds are not numbered. I missed the most recent spike, I think it was May 2011 when it shot up to about $50 per oz. I think the previous spike to that was around 1970 due to market manipulation, again at about $50 per oz. A clue about ebay .. beware of buying ANY coinage or bullion, with an origin from China.
Might that be a 100 oz. bar for $2200 .. those zero's can throw ya butted up against that "oz"

I'm hoping their prices will drop a little more. I'm expecting a large amount of money in the next week and part will be put in silver at least and maybe some gold.. I expect a major collapse by years end. I also have barter materiels that have proven popular in the past during such periods.
My bomb shelter is full of $100,000 bars.
